recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper.

steps.instruction: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
In a pan, cook the pancetta over medium heat until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
Drain the spaghetti and add it to the pan with pancetta. Remove from heat and quickly mix in the egg mixture.
Toss everything together until the pasta is evenly coated and creamy. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chicken Curry
recipes.description: A flavorful and spicy Indian curry dish.

steps.instruction: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add minced garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add diced tomatoes and cook until they break down into a thick sauce.
Stir in the curry powder and cook for 1 minute to release its flavors.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are browned on all sides.
Pour in enough water to cover the chicken, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, then serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: A rich and moist chocolate cake, perfect for any occasion.

steps.instruction: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a cake tin.
In a bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa powder, and baking powder.
In a separate bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with milk. Stir in the vanilla extract.
Pour the batter into the prepared cake tin and bake for 35-40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn it out onto a wire rack to cool completely before frosting or serving.

recipes.name: Caesar Salad
recipes.description: A fresh and crisp salad with romaine lettuce, croutons, Parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.

steps.instruction: Wash and chop the romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, toss the lettuce with croutons and grated Parmesan cheese.
Drizzle the Caesar dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
Add lemon juice and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Beef Stroganoff
recipes.description: Tender strips of beef in a creamy mushroom sauce.

steps.instruction: Slice the beef into thin strips and season with salt and pepper.
In a large pan, heat oil over medium-high heat and sear the beef until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add chopped onions and garlic, cooking until softened.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture and begin to brown.
Pour in the beef broth and bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.
Stir in the sour cream and Dijon mustard, then return the beef to the pan. Simmer for another 10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot over egg noodles or rice.

recipes.name: Pancakes
recipes.description: Fluffy and golden pancakes perfect for a weekend breakfast.

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and sugar.
In another bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly grease with butter.
Pour batter onto the pan and cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve hot with your choice of toppings, such as maple syrup, fruit, or whipped cream.

recipes.name: Margarita Pizza
recipes.description: A simple and classic pizza with tomato, mozzarella, and basil.

steps.instruction: Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Top with sliced mozzarella cheese and drizzle with olive oil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
Remove from the oven and scatter fresh basil leaves over the top before serving.

recipes.name: Tiramisu
recipes.description: A classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cream.

steps.instruction: Brew the espresso coffee and let it cool to room temperature.
In a bowl, whisk the egg yolks with sugar until pale and creamy. Stir in the mascarpone cheese until smooth.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold them into the mascarpone mixture.
Dip the ladyfingers into the cooled espresso coffee and arrange them in a single layer in a dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers, then repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and mascarpone.
Dust the top with cocoa powder and refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir Fry
recipes.description: A quick and healthy stir fry with a mix of colorful vegetables and a savory sauce.

steps.instruction: Cut the bell peppers, broccoli, and carrots into bite-sized pieces.
Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and ginger, cooking for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp.
Pour in the soy sauce and cook for an additional 2 minutes, tossing to coat the vegetables evenly.
Serve hot with rice or noodles.

recipes.name: Apple Pie
recipes.description: A classic dessert with a flaky crust and sweet apple filling.

steps.instruction: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Peel, core, and slice the apples. Toss with sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice.
In a bowl, mix the flour and butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add cold water a little at a time until a dough forms.
Roll out half of the dough and fit it into a pie dish. Fill with the apple mixture.
Roll out the remaining dough and place it over the apples. Trim and crimp the edges to seal.
Brush the top crust with a beaten egg and cut a few slits for steam to escape.
Bake for 50-60 minutes until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbling. Let cool before serving.
